page.title: 11Housing In Norton Area.
page.content: Some of the housing in our twelve squares is old; many of the houses are over 100 years old. The Hundred House Hotel is old and has 4 storeys in it. Most houses have 2 storeys, and some are bungalows. Some of the farmhouses are big. The old school at Ryton has been made into a house, and the playground into a tennis court. There are several thatched cottages in the Norton area. The newest house is Nettlestones in Norton, and I think the oldest building in the area is Higford Mill. In Sutton Maddock the Council Houses are by the garage and in Vicarage Lane, and in Norton they are in Cheswardine Lane. Apley Estate owns many houses in the Norton district, but elsewhere it is privately owned property.
